name: ngrx

schema.title: Add NgRx support to an application or library.
schema.description: Adds NgRx support to an application or library.

examples.description: Add root ngrx configration to the `my-app` application
Add a `users` state with a facade to the `my-lib` library. It will be tracked under the default `+state` folder in the lib

name.description: Name of the NgRx feature state, such as `products` or `users`. Recommended to use the plural form of the name.
name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the NgRx feature state? An example would be `users`.

module.description: The path to the `NgModule` where the feature state will be registered. The host directory will create/use the new state directory.
module.x-prompt: What is the path to the module where this NgRx state should be registered?

directory.description: The name of the folder used to contain/group the generated NgRx files.

root.description: Setup root or feature state management with NgRx.
root.x-prompt: Is this the root state of the application?

facade.description: Create a Facade class for the the feature.
facade.x-prompt: Would you like to use a Facade with your NgRx state?

skipImport.description: Generate NgRx feature files without registering the feature in the NgModule.

minimal.description: Only register the root state management setup or feature state.

skipPackageJson.description: Do not update the `package.json` with NgRx dependencies.

barrels.description: Use barrels to re-export actions, state and selectors.

description: Adds NgRx support to an application or library.
